text: ਗਾਵੈ ਕੋ ਤਾਣੁ ਹੋਵੈ ਕਿਸੈ ਤਾਣੁ ॥
section: Jap Ji Sahib (Song Of The Soul)

translation.text: Some sing of His Power-who has that Power?

transliteration.text: gāvai kō tān hōvai kisai tān .

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

author.author: Guru Nanak Dev
author.description:
Guru Nanak Dev Ji [1469 - 1539] was the first Guru of the Sikhs born in a village named Talwandi which is now called Nankana Sahib and is in Pakistan. As a child Guru Nanak spent most of his time in isolation and meditation. He slept only for a few hours, ate small quantities of food and spoke little.

One day he disappeared while having his morning bath and reappeared 3 days later and said: There is no Hindu and there is no Muslim. By saying this he meant that titles were meaningless because all of humanity is one and the light of God shines within everyone.

section: Jap Ji Sahib (Song Of The Soul)

translation.text: Some sing of His Gifts, and know His Sign and Insignia.

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

author.author: Guru Nanak Dev
author.description:

section: Jap Ji Sahib (Song Of The Soul)

translation.text: Some sing of His Glorious Virtues, Greatness and Beauty.

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

section: Jap Ji Sahib (Song Of The Soul)

translation.text: Some sing of knowledge obtained of Him, through difficult philosophical studies.

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

text: ਗਾਵੈ ਕੋ ਸਾਜਿ ਕਰੇ ਤਨੁ ਖੇਹ ॥
section: Jap Ji Sahib (Song Of The Soul)

translation.text: Some sing that He fashions the body, and then again reduces it to dust.

transliteration.text: gāvai kō sāj karē tan khēh .

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

One day he disappeared while having his morning bath and reappeared 3 days later and said: There is no Hindu and there is no Muslim. By saying this he meant that titles were meaningless because all of humanity is one and the light of God shines within everyone.

text: ਗਾਵੈ ਕੋ ਜੀਅ ਲੈ ਫਿਰਿ ਦੇਹ ॥
section: Jap Ji Sahib (Song Of The Soul)

translation.text: Some sing that He takes life away, and then again restores it.

transliteration.text: gāvai kō jī lai phir dēh .

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

section: Jap Ji Sahib (Song Of The Soul)

translation.text: Some sing that He seems so very far away.

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

section: Jap Ji Sahib (Song Of The Soul)

translation.text: Some sing that He watches over us, face to face, ever-present.

section: Jap Ji Sahib (Song Of The Soul)

translation.text: There is no shortage of those who preach and teach.

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

text: ਕਥਿ ਕਥਿ ਕਥੀ ਕੋਟੀ ਕੋਟਿ ਕੋਟਿ ॥
section: Jap Ji Sahib (Song Of The Soul)

translation.text: Millions upon millions offer millions of sermons and stories.

transliteration.text: kath kath kathī kōtī kōt kōt .

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

section: Jap Ji Sahib (Song Of The Soul)

translation.text: The Great Giver keeps on giving, while those who receive grow weary of receiving.

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

section: Jap Ji Sahib (Song Of The Soul)

translation.text: The Commander, by His Command, leads us to walk on the Path.

section: Jap Ji Sahib (Song Of The Soul)

translation.text: O Nanak, He blossoms forth, Carefree and Untroubled. ||3||

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood
